text:
The arrest of Chhagan Bhujbal by the ED in connection with its probe in a money laundering case rocked the Maharashtra Legislature on Tuesday with Opposition Congress and the NCP members alleging “vendetta politics” by the BJP-led government.

NCP workers took to the streets in Mumbai and blocked the busy Mumbai-Agra national highway in Nashik, Mr. Bhujbal’s home district. Over 150 workers of the NCP were detained when they were staging “rasta rokos” to protest against their leader’s arrest.

In Nashik district, Mr. Bhujbal’s supporters blocked the highway near Ozar, 21 km from city, and staged a protest. — PTI
title: Protests in Mumbai, Nashik
